page.title: 02NATURAL HISTORY IN DENBIGH
page.content: The area is mainly open countryside interspersed with much mixed woodland.The land height increases from{100'}A.S.L.in the East to{600'}in the West,with the limestone outcrops emerging as height increases.A wide variety of wildlife is supported throughout the whole area,{37}species of flowers were identified during a 1 hour observation,the{early purple {orchid}occuring but once on a sheltered bank.The{primrose}was scarce despite the abundance of favourable sites. All the common birds were seen including{ravens}which nest in the nearby{limestone quarry.}Many small mammals are also known to exist.{Foxes are present although there is no evidence of{badgers,}the land being too low lying tothe East and too close to human habitations in the West.
